event: Early human ancestors inhabit regions of present-day Germany
Germanic tribes dominate central and northern Europe
Germanic victory over Rome at the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest
Western Roman authority collapses across Germanic territories
Charlemagne rules much of Central Europe from a Frankish empire
Treaty of Verdun divides the Carolingian Empire, shaping East Francia
Holy Roman Empire is founded, centered on German lands
Imperial cities and regional principalities flourish
Golden Bull formalizes imperial electoral system
Martin Luther launches the Protestant Reformation
Peace of Augsburg legalizes religious division in the empire
Thirty Years’ War devastates German lands
Peace of Westphalia establishes state sovereignty principles
Kingdom of Prussia is proclaimed
Prussia emerges as a major European military power
Holy Roman Empire is dissolved during Napoleonic wars
German Confederation is formed after Napoleon’s defeat
Liberal revolutions challenge monarchies across German states
German Empire is unified under Prussian leadership
Germany enters World War I as a central power
German Empire collapses and republic is proclaimed
Nazi regime seizes power
Germany initiates World War II in Europe
Germany is defeated and divided after World War II
East and West Germany are formally established
Berlin Wall is constructed, symbolizing Cold War division
Fall of the Berlin Wall marks the end of division
German reunification restores national unity
